column4: Anybody HELP please ... I have an external Sony DVD burner that does not mount automatically. I have to reboot the machine everytime I plug it in. It used to work well a few weeks ago ...
first check is to run 'tail -f /var/log/syslog' in a terminal, then plug it in. See if any errors are logged.
looks okay to me. What's the problem at this point?
explain "does not mount". Is there a disk in the drive?
in order to have to blank dvd icon on the desktop I have to reboot.
look at the settings under System-Preferences-Removable Drives
everything is OK I did not touch anything here, and it works with my 16gb usb stick
does the icon appear if you open, then close the tray?
have you tried with a data CD instead of a blank? Any messages in /var/log/syslog after the tray closes?
does anything happen when you do 'sudo eject /dev/sr0' while  the tray is closed?
no, there are various packages. apt-cache search festival
it's also wrong. You should have either relattime or noatime, not both. noatime is in the wrong place.
you haven't told me what your problem is
